headline: Dramatic upregulation in feline sexual stages and tachyzoites with cell cycle regulation
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits extreme stage-specific expression in Toxoplasma gondii with highest levels during sexual development in the definitive feline host.
  • Shows 25-75 fold higher expression in feline enteroepithelial stages (EES1-5) compared to tissue cysts
  • Maintains high expression in tachyzoites (~1,100-2,500 TPM) but is dramatically reduced in bradyzoites
  • Displays cell cycle-dependent oscillation with biphasic peaks every 6 hours
  • Increases significantly during oocyst sporulation from day 0 to day 10
The gene appears constitutively expressed at high levels in actively replicating stages but is downregulated during chronic infection phases. This expression pattern suggests a critical role in parasite replication and sexual reproduction, potentially functioning in cell division machinery or metabolic processes required for rapid proliferation.

topics.headline: Extreme upregulation during sexual development in feline hosts
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows dramatic 25-75 fold upregulation in all feline enteroepithelial stages (EES1-5) compared to other life cycle stages, indicating critical importance for sexual reproduction in the definitive host.

topics.headline: Strong temporal regulation during oocyst sporulation
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression increases ~72-fold during the 10-day sporulation process from unsporulated to fully mature sporulated oocysts, suggesting essential roles in oocyst development and maturation.

topics.headline: Cell cycle-dependent oscillatory expression pattern
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene exhibits clear biphasic oscillation during the cell cycle with peaks at 0-1 hours and 7-8 hours post-synchronization, indicating tight regulation linked to cell division processes.

topics.headline: Enhanced expression during intracellular parasitism
topics.one_sentence_summary: Both transcriptional and translational levels are significantly higher in intracellular versus extracellular parasites, suggesting functional importance for host cell exploitation and intracellular survival.

topics.headline: High tachyzoite expression with downregulation during bradyzoite differentiation
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene maintains high expression in acute tachyzoite stages but shows significant 5-7 fold downregulation during chronic bradyzoite differentiation, indicating stage-specific functional requirements.

topics.headline: Upregulation in merozoites compared to tachyzoites
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression levels are consistently 1.5-2.5 fold higher in merozoites compared to tachyzoites, suggesting specialized functions during the sexual cycle stage that occurs in feline intestinal epithelium.

topics.headline: Consistently high expression throughout tachyzoite development
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene maintains constitutively high expression (96th-98th percentile) across tachyzoite time courses with peak levels at mid-infection timepoints, indicating essential functions throughout asexual replication.

topics.headline: Higher expression during acute versus chronic infection phases
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression is substantially higher during acute infection (429 TPM) compared to chronic infection (87 TPM) in mouse brain, correlating with the transition from actively replicating tachyzoites to dormant bradyzoites.

topics.headline: Stage-specific differences between tachyzoites and sporozoites
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows over 10-fold higher expression in tachyzoites (748 TPM) compared to sporozoites (67 TPM), indicating distinct functional requirements between these asexual life cycle stages.

topics.headline: Strain-specific expression differences during neuronal infection
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression is dramatically higher in type III strain-infected neurons (280 TPM) compared to type II strain-infected neurons (61 TPM), suggesting strain-dependent regulation during CNS infection.
